thread.title: Car Sales, Jobs Report, Earnings Are Highlights This Week
thread.title_full: Car Sales, Jobs Report, Earnings Are Highlights This Week

title: Car Sales, Jobs Report, Earnings Are Highlights This Week
text:
Car Sales, Jobs Report, Earnings Are Highlights This Week By Kurumi Fukushima | 08/02/15 - 12:15 PM EDT Reprint 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- U.S. car sales, the July employment situation report, key earnings reports and economic data are all expected highlights on Wall Street for the week of Aug. 3. 
Automakers gear up to report their sales figures Monday. Fiat Chrysler ( FCAU ) releases its sales first at 8:30 a.m. ET, followed by Ford ( F - Get Report ) and General Motors ( GM - Get Report ) . Industrywide auto sales are expected to be strong again for the month of July. GM's volume is likely to come in lighter after the company reduced sales to rental-car companies .The jobs report is due Friday. Wall Street will be watching the unemployment number, which TheStreet's Jim Cramer says is the most important figure that moves the market. The labor department is expected to report employers added more than 200,000 jobs in July, keeping the jobless rate unchanged at the seven-year low of 5.3%. Other notable companies reporting quarterly earnings include American International Group ( AIG - Get Report ) , CVS Health ( CVS - Get Report ) , Walt Disney ( DIS - Get Report ) , Twenty-First Century Fox ( FOXA - Get Report ) , CBS ( CBS - Get Report ) , Time Warner ( TWX - Get Report ) , Tesla Motors ( TSLA - Get Report ) , Priceline Group ( PCLN - Get Report ) , Fitbit ( FIT ) , Allergan ( AGN - Get Report ) , JD.com ( JD - Get Report ) and WhiteWave Foods ( WWAV - Get Report ) . Tesla Motors is scheduled to report second-quarter earnings Wednesday after the closing bell. The electric-car maker is expected to post its third straight quarterly loss. Fitbit will report its first quarterly earnings figures since going public . The wearable fitness device maker is slated to release results midweek. On the economic calendar, data is due including personal income and outlays , factory orders and international trade. Check Out Our Best Services for Investors 
Portfolio Manager Jim Cramer and Director of Research Jack Mohr reveal their investment tactics while giving advanced notice before every trade. Product Features:
